author: andreialex
title: Decentralized Reserve Currency
description: オリンパス・ダオやカルダノの3,3ゲーム理論のようなものを導入し、複数の資産に裏付けられた分散型基軸通貨を導入する。

f6_assessments.q0: While the idea behind the proposal could be good, it fails to bring anything new to the table. If the proposal is to replicate olympus dao, why would people use the Cardano implementation instead of the original, which already has a lot of followers? The success of this kind of project is critically dependent on widespread adoption on user onboarding (hence why olympus DAO is often compared to a ponzi), and this proposal fails to identify how they would achieve the ambitious feat of competing with Olympus Dao on it's own territory.
f6_assessments.q1: Beyond being a plutus pioneer program graduate, the proposer does not mention any blockchain, game theory or programming skill background. The plan of basically reverse engineering Olympus DAO's implementation from its documentation and translating it to Cardano is very ambitious and unlikely to be achievable by a single individual. There is no roadmap and milestones
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal doesn't have any auditable success metric, KPI or milestone. No risk and challenge assessment is done. There is no roadmap to gauge the success at various steps of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is missing a lot of information to get a positive rating. The proposer should better identify a problem in this challenge. Furthermore the proposer should articulate how the proposal adds value to the ecosystem. The proposer should also include key metrics and goals that align with the challenge. The proposer can use previous funded projects as reference to write a better proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The information missing in this proposal makes it difficult to give it a positive note. The proposer should add evidence of relevance skills and experience. The number of team members needed to achieve the goal is needed. The budget should be broken down into identifiable pieces.The proposer should also add a plan in case additional funding is needed. A timetable to complete the work is also necessary to gain points on the feasibility. Altogether, this proposal lacks necessary information to be successfully implemented.

The number of team members needed to achieve the goal is needed. The budget should be broken down into identifiable pieces.The proposer should also add a plan in case additional funding is needed. A timetable to complete the work is also necessary to gain points on the feasibility. Altogether, this proposal lacks necessary information to be successfully implemented.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is to build Decentralized Reserve Currency backed by stable coins. This is being pursued in the best possible researched manner to get Djed. Therefore the proposal may not be adding more value that what is already envisaaged.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no reference to the proposers past work and the proposal also lacks detailed implementation plan. The proposer claims to be a plutus pioneer but the proposal needs fairly involved developmental activity to achieve what it intends.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is just expressing an idea to implement a Olympus Dao to get a stable coin in Cardano. The proposal does not include a plan and has not show any team which will implement the proposal. Fund of 10000 for developing such a system looks too optimistic. with no feasibility study it is difficult to rate the project as feasible.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a draft proposal. Relevant information about the impact of this proposal is missing. This proposal is not executable nor does it provide information on how this idea will create value to the Cardano Ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer doesn't provide relevant information on how to implement this idea. The idea is not clear described. A plan is missing. Also we don't find any information about the proposer.
f6_assessments.q2: No info has been provided to show how this project will solve the problems it wants to solve. There is no way to track the progress or success of this project.

f6_assessments.q0:
"Making something like Olympus Knife like on Ethereum not with Solidity but with Plutus is a very cool idea. Because we all know how superior Plutus is compared to Solidity. Therefore, it would be a product with more advantages than the Olumpus Knife if it could be done.
But in this proposal, I only see an idea, but no specific product has been offered. And the proposer has not clearly stated the factors that make up the impact of the proposal such as:
How does OHM work and examples of how it can benefit the ecosystem
Why is it needed in the Ecosystem?
Features of your Protocol
Assets to be used within the protocol
Tokenomics and distribution method"
f6_assessments.q1:
"Although the proposal has experience in completing the plutus pioneer program. But that is not enough to make this product. Because to build a large product like Olympus Dao, it takes a lot of experience in implementing long-term Dapp projects to ensure the smooth and safe operation of the system's features.
In addition, the proposal does not have a specific plan, timeline and specific explanation of the product as well as the specific work that the team will perform. Therefore, the proposal is almost not feasible"
f6_assessments.q2:
"Proposal is currently still an idea, but there is no plan or specific product. Therefore the proposal is not auditable.
I hope the proposer will be able to research and develop a specific plan and solution for this proposal in fund 8, I look forward to seeing this product come to fruition. In order for the proposal to be auditable, the proposer should provide information on:
What success looks like & key metrics to measure this success (i.e. users, TVL, forks etc)
Breakdown of funding allocation (i.e. where will the funds be used)"

f6_assessments.q0: This is a potentially interesting proposal for the Cardano ecosystem as it benefits by adding DeFi 2.0, however, it lacks clear details on the types of assets that will be backed (other than Djed), unique features and also value for users to actually use this protocol.
f6_assessments.q1: I believe the documentation is great, it shows that it can be done. There is not much information on the team that will be involved in this proposal in terms of business, advisors and the support to build the protocol.
f6_assessments.q2: I see you have mentioned the Djed to be the stablecoin, thus the protocol will be backed by it. Though, it would be great if we have a breakdown allocation on the tokenomics; as how it is distributed towards the community and the protocol. Also, the capability to sustain during any potential price drop.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal focuses on converting Olympus Dao solidity contracts onto Plutus. The problem statement is not likely to describe the problem and is not explained in detail. Because this proposal is not completed, the solution is still very abstract, however, in my opinion, this idea is worth trying for completing in the future. Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's impact, and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer's profile is briefly described [completing the Plutus pioneer program] however, without any proof/link for verification. Therefore, definitely, there are no grounds to agree on the feasibility of this proposal, however, my advice would be: in case it is necessary to complete this proposal in the future, the proposer should pay attention to ensure that the following components are fully met: (i) Goals and target; (2) road map (integrated with measurable KPIs/metrics); (3) Budget breakdown; (4) Risk and challenge. Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's feasible, and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q2: It is hard to evaluate an incomplete proposal like this where auditability/transparency can't be guaranteed. Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's auditability, and would give it a score of 1.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of the proposal to implement something like Olympus Dao in Plutus is wonderful and absolutely addresses the challenge well. However, the details of the project are not presented sufficiently enough.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience, beyond participating in the pioneer program, is not sufficiently presented to evaluate the likelihood of the proposal to be implemented successfully. The plan needs to be much a more substantial to be considered for successful funding.
f6_assessments.q2: Information to audit the progress and the success of the project is not presented in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer does not establish a problem that is addressed by the solution. Additionally, the implied use of djed may demonstrate that proposer hasn't scanned or isn't familiar with other defi projects seeking to issue stable coins.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer doesn't clarify whether they successfully completed the plutus pioneer program, and whether they have other relevant expertise. And given the proliferation of OHM forks witnessed on several other chains, the potential cost to the community may outweigh the potential benefit (if any). Finally, defi assets backing such a project may need a few cycles to fully mature for such a solution to offer durable success.
f6_assessments.q2: The project offers no breakdown of project tasks or timelines. Assessor assumes funds would be used for single engineers time and efforts.
